long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Configures MySQL database servers that act as a Master-DB. Specifically designed for RightScale's Manager for MySQL-EBS. Storage of MySQL data will be done using EBS Volumes. EBS Snapshots are used for database backups.

= REQUIREMENTS:

* The RightScale public cookbooks must be in your cookbook path.
* The Opscode public cookbooks must be in your cookbook path.
* Due to the EBS dependency, this currently only runs on EC2 clouds.
* Requires a DNSMadeEasy.com account.

= ATTRIBUTES: 

See metadata.rb 

= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale server template with the following run order:

Boot Scripts
  * install_mysql - performs base server install and configuration. (RightScale public cookbook)
  * continuous_backups - Schedule continuous backups of the database.

Operational Scripts
  * restore_master - restores the database from the most recent snapshot and sets master DNS.
  * backup - backs up the binary DB contents to an EBS snapshot.
  * register_public_ip - Registers the public IP of the current instance to dns madeeasy.
  
Decommission Scripts
  * decommission - stops the database and detaches EBS volume.
name: db_mysql

db_mysql\/backup\/keep_minimum.description: The minimum number of snapshots to keep. The oldest snapshot will be deleted when this is exceeded. This is overrides of the Daily, Weekly, etc. backup count.  Typically set to the total number of backups made in a day.

db_mysql\/server_usage.description:
* dedicated (where the mysql config allocates all existing resources of the machine)
* shared (where the mysql is configured to use less resources so that it can be run concurrently with other apps like apache and rails for example)

dns\/password.description: The password of your DNSMadeEasy account.

db_mysql\/replication_user.description: The username that's used for replication between master and slave databases.

db_mysql\/datadir_relocate.description: This sets final destination of the MySQL data directory. (i.e. an LVM or EBS volume)

db_mysql\/backup\/keep_yearly.description: The number of yearly snapshots to keep (i.e. rotation size). See 'Archiving Snapshots' on RightScale Support for further details on the archiving logic.

db_mysql\/backup\/keep_monthly.description: The number of monthly snapshots to keep (i.e. rotation size). See 'Archiving Snapshots' on RightScale Support for further details on the archiving logic.

db_mysql\/admin_password.description: The password of the database user that has 'admin' privilages.

db_mysql\/tmpdir.description: This sets the tmp variable in MySQL config file.

db_mysql\/log_bin.description: Defines the filename and location of your MySQL stored binlog files.  This sets the log-bin variable in MySQL config file.  If you do not specify an absolute path, it will be relative to the data directory.

db_mysql\/backup\/keep_daily.description: The number of daily snapshots to keep (i.e. rotation size). See 'Archiving Snapshots' on RightScale Support for further details on the archiving logic.

db_mysql\/backup\/prefix_override.description: Override prefix to restore from a specific snapshot.

db_mysql\/dns\/master_id.description: The record ID (or DNS ID) of the server is used to update the DNS record to point to the new server IP address. This 7-digit number is provided by DNSMadeEasy. This record should point to the fully qualified domain name of the servers EIP.  Ex: 4404922

db_mysql\/dns\/ttl_limit.description: Verification that master database DNS TTL is low enough. WARNING: can produce false positives.

db_mysql\/dns\/master_name.description: This DNS name is the FNDQ MySQL Master used by the slave and application to connect to the MySQL server

db_mysql\/admin_user.description: The username of the database user that has 'admin' privilages.

db_mysql\/backup\/keep_weekly.description: The number of weekly snapshots to keep (i.e. rotation size). See 'Archiving Snapshots' on RightScale Support for further details on the archiving logic.

db_mysql\/backup\/prefix.description: The prefix that will be used to name the EBS snapshots of your MySQL database backups.  For example, if prefix is 'mydb' the filename will be 'mydb-master-date/time stamp' for a snapshot of your master database and 'mydb-slave-date/time stamp' for a slave.  During a restore, it will use the most recent MySQL EBS snapshot with the same prefix.

dns\/user.description: The username of your DNSMadeEasy account.

db_mysql\/replication_password.description: The password that's used for replication between master and slave databases.

recipes.db_mysql::do_ddns_check: Throw an error of the DNS TTL is too high.
recipes.db_mysql::do_register_public_ip: Registers the public IP of the current instance to dns madeeasy.
recipes.db_mysql::decommission: Stop DB, Unmount, detach and delete the current volume mounted for mysql DB.
recipes.db_mysql::do_backup: Backs up the binary DB contents to an EBS snapshot.
recipes.db_mysql::setup_continuous_backups: Schedule continuous backups of the database.
recipes.db_mysql::do_restore_master: Restores the database from the most recent EBS snapshot and updates DNS to point to the new master.

description: Installs/configures a MySQL database server with automated backups
